programme.title: La Vuelta Femenina 25: Stage 1
programme.desc: Stage 1: Barcelona > Barcelona TTT. This was a thrilling team time trial in Barcelona. Lidl-Trek emerged victorious, covering the 8.1 km course in 9:30 minutes.

programme.title: La Vuelta Femenina 25: Stage 2
programme.desc: Stage 2: Molins de Rei > Sant Boi de Llobregat. A 99 km route was won by Marianne Vos in a thrilling uphill sprint. Letizia Paternoster took the overall lead after finishing second.

programme.title: La Vuelta Femenina 25: Stage 3
programme.desc: Stage 3: Barbastro > Huesca. This stage was won by Femke Gerritse in a bunch sprint .She narrowly beat Marianne Vos and Linda Zanetti to take the stage win and the overall race lead.

programme.title: La Vuelta Femenina 25: Stage 4
programme.desc: Stage 4: Pedrola > Borja. This 111 km route featured medium mountain terrain with two categorized climbs. Marianne Vos claimed victory in a dramatic uphill finish, reclaiming the overall lead.

programme.title: La Vuelta Femenina 25: Stage 5
programme.desc: Stage 5: Golmayo > Lagunas de Neila. A 120.4 km route was won by Demi Vollering after a powerful solo attack on the final climb. Marlen Reusser finished second, and Anna van der Breggen came in third.

programme.title: La Vuelta Femenina 25: Stage 6
programme.desc: Stage 6: Becerril de Campos > Baltanas. This is the second-last stage covering a 126.7 km flat route from Becerril de Campos to Baltanás in a bunch sprint.

programme.title: La Vuelta Femenina 25: Stage 7
programme.desc: Stage 7: La Robla > Cotobello Asturias. This is the longest and toughest stage, covering 152.6 km from La Robla to Cotobello Asturias.

programme.title: Arctic Race of Norway HL 25

programme.title: Desporto Mwangole

programme.title: Desporto Mwangole
